full_text: Blue and yellow make green this year.  Beautiful and poignant video from our colleagues @dfatirl  As we enjoy all the creativity and pageantry of the marches on our own streets today we are also walking in solidarity with the people of #ukraine  Happy #StPatricksDay https://t.co/DRL88rfwA2

Goodbye #WashingtonDC hello #NYCgov after a great train trip. At every meeting with top White House officials we spoke about the need to work together to switch rapidly to alternative energy systems to guarantee our energy independence. Looking forward now to #StPatricksDay NYC. https://t.co/5tN9Wl1dEH
Delighted to have the opportunity to discuss shared #Ireland & #USA climate priorities, offshore wind and energy emissions with @SecGranholm the Secretary of Energy. https://t.co/jtiR0Tu5js

Bright skies and bright conversation about how Ireland and US can work together on #climateaction with @RickDuke1 @ClimateEnvoy and getting ready to meet with @PeteButtigieg @secretarypete on sustainable travel - a key focus for #USA and #Ireland #sustainablemobity https://t.co/4DBmQSHADK

Packed and exciting Day 1 here in @washingtondc ahead of #StPatricksDay Looking forward to thought provoking meetings with @ginamccarthy46 @WhiteHouse #ClimateChange Advisor, @petebuttegieg @SecretaryPete @USDOT, and @RickDuke1 @ClimateEnvoy with @DanMulhall @IrelandEmbUSA 🇮🇪🇺🇸☘️

Parents from ‘Model’ & ‘Project’ schools in Limerick shield their children through Shannonbridge roundabout. I’d a good meeting with ⁦@LimerickCouncil⁩ yesterday. One of the issues was how we accelerate safe active travel. ⁦@BrianLeddin⁩ ⁦@sasanovak48⁩ #cyclebus https://t.co/x9hZWevNGW
The haulage sector has a hugely important role to play in the economy - keeping vital goods available to people and businesses. https://t.co/fFeTBFHbmh

Wonderful meeting with the people of Limerick tonight in the @TheLPYMA to discuss the future of transport  & energy here in Limerick.  Thanks to @BrianLeddin @sasanovak48 @seanohartigan and the Limerick Greens for hosting me. https://t.co/R6FpqlL1YZ

I know many of you have been in touch with the generous offer of opening your home to our Ukrainian friends.  @rodericogorman & @irishredcross have launched a national portal where you can register potential accommodation options.  Full details: https://t.co/JPRx0h34wG https://t.co/ciOiMZMZts

Maria Ionava, a member of the #Ukraine parliament gave a heart rendering account from Kiev to a ⁦@greenparty_ie⁩ webinar tonight. She rightly framed the war as a conflict between those who defend democratic freedom within a multilateral order & an autocratic violent regime. https://t.co/oBUuDcfC1w

Highlight today was talking at the 1st meeting of the #YouthAssemblyIRL  This is a significant milestone and I am grateful to all the young people who gave up their time & added their voice to help us shape the future.  As we all know young people are vital to the transition 🌍 https://t.co/mQfTopnYV6

Ireland will contribute to a release of strategic oil stocks to show solidarity with #Ukraine and help counter shocks to global oil supplies, coming from the invasion. At an emergency @IEA meeting we also called for new energy efficiency measures, to cut our use of fossil fuels. https://t.co/qzwAEcfNnU

The emergency EU energy council is discussing how we can help Ukraine, by synchronising our electricity grids & supplying them with fuels. We all agree we must end our dependency on Russian hydrocarbons. The best way to put it up to Mr Putin is to stop buying his gas. #solidarity https://t.co/lRQGBbHJrJ

The #IPCC report is another warning on how the climate crisis is destroying our ecosystems & biodiversity.  There is still time but the window of opportunity is closing rapidly.  My department has provided millions for adaptation measures to reduce risk.  Read more below 👇👇 https://t.co/jgbFS8u8eV

At a meeting of @europeangreens leaders this evening, we share our outrage and outright condemnation of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. We commit our support for Ukranian colleagues and agree we will do everything we can to peacefully counter this catastrophic act.  #Ukraine https://t.co/2wmkijWvrG

Have a say on Ireland's Digital Connectivity Strategy which encompasses   👉 Delivering of National Broadband Plan 👉 Implementation of Cyber Security Strategy  👉Supporting new & innovative connectivity solutions  👉Safeguarding our international connectivity   #Openconsulation https://t.co/r0JsP1Rde9

Recharging infrastructure is vital for the expansion of electric cars.  The new powers for TII is essential component in providing them.  Another step towards our 2030 targets 🎯 https://t.co/LmTUBuSNI4

Great work by @stevensgreen1 and @greenparty_ie .  This Bill would offer us the opportunity to reimagine the built environment, rejuvent our towns and bring an end to dereliction. https://t.co/Ab8n6mZxat

It was a really inspiring night the Anchorage Project ‘Train the Trainers’ graduation. There was a real sense of optimism & green shoots in the air with the local Ringsend & Irishtown community & what the future can hold. Such great work by Joe & all the team as always. https://t.co/dRnUTOCxx5

The Carbon Tax is the ONLY tax that guarantees the money goes back to the people.  It goes to increase social welfare provisions ; fuel allowance, children's allowance  To measures to cut emissions: retrofit scheme etc  There is detailed analysis to show how progressive this is!

Pearse asked me 'What planet are we living on ?'  We are living on the one we want to protect. The one were we want to stop the burning 🔥  The one were we don't just talk about climate change,we action it !  The Greens brought in targeted measures that make a real difference https://t.co/9DYBb5c7Lx

This time last week we launched the retrofitting scheme.   Delighted with the positive feedback we have been receiving   ✔Reducing energy use  ✔Replacing fossil fuels ✔Reaching our carbon targets ✔Pathway to meeting our 500k B2 homes by 2030  ✔Decarbonising our housing https://t.co/5Vsj2IYXT1
A great painter and politician. First female Dublin Councillor, a leading Home Rule campaigner, feminist, social reformer and advocate for poor relief. https://t.co/2jVrHK5t3Q

Council’s have a crucial role in tackling climate change.  As local leaders are rooted in their communities and understand local needs and opportunities.  Thank you @ClareCoCo  and @RoisinGarvey for the opportunity to talk with the public representatives #ClimateActionPlan https://t.co/DPWBcrOZV0

⭐️Railway Union Sports Club  ⭐️Irishtown 5 a side pitch  ⭐️Herzog Park Tennis Court  The money will help build tracks, pitches, changing rooms, lighting, improve accessiblity and more that the whole community can benefit from.

⭐️Landsdowne Football Club ⭐️Leinster Cricket Club ⭐️Mount Pleasants Tennis Club   ⭐️RICC Centre Boxing Club  ⭐️Old Wesley RFC ⭐️Our Ladys School Terenure ⭐️Pembroke Wanderers  ⭐️Terenure Sports Club ⭐️Terenure College RFC ⭐️Terenure Sports Club

A record €150m for Sports Capital Grants announced by @cathmartingreen. Sport is so important for health,wellbeing & community & approx €1.2m will go to Dublin Bay South clubs incl:  ⭐️Clanna Gael Fontenoy  ⭐️45th Mount Argus Scouts   ⭐️Dartry Scouts  ⭐️Kenilworth Bowling 👇👇 https://t.co/iH785M1CkH

32 social housing retrofitted in Ennis    Visiting the Cloughleigh retrofitting with Anne Haugh director of services for housing in Co.Clare.  Retrofitting makes economic & environmental sense which is why we launched the BIGGEST home insulation scheme this week  #TimeToRetrofit https://t.co/xoHCg8ysSQ
Morning walk with students from Gaelscoil Mhíchíl Cíosóg in Ennis Co.Clare and @RoisinGarvey  Part of a wonderful active travel measure 'the walking bus' 🚍 #activetravel https://t.co/rmrZtrHWhf

The Government have agreed further measures to tackle rising costs, including a 20% cut in public transport fares, a new fuel allowance payment and reductions to electricity & medical bills. They are practical measures to counter inflation and help deliver sustainable policies. https://t.co/3Dcv5rt07Q
Climate Action🌍🌍  ✔Reducing energy use  ✔Replacing fossil fuels ✔Reaching our carbon targets ✔Pathway to meeting our 500k B2 homes by 2030  ✔Decarbonising our housing
Creating Jobs 👷‍♀️👷‍♀️  👉High quality jobs across Ireland  👉Upskilling & reskilling to provide the workforce   👉20 One Stop Shops by 2023
Warmer, cheaper homes in 2022:    27,00 private home energy upgrades   4,800 free upgrades  2,400 local authority homes
Making it Easy:  ✔Simplified grants process ✔Expanding eligibility for all schemes  ✔Establishing 'One Stop Shops'  ✔Better management & governance

Tackling Energy Poverty:   👉Expanding free energy poverty schemes & eligibility 👉'Worst First' approach targeting most in need 👉Quicker process to retrofit 400 homes p/mth  👉Increasing local authority schemes 👉Landlords & AHB's to access grants 👉Reducing bills

More investment:  €267m in 2022 - €202m from carbon tax  €119m for energy poverty schemes  45 to 51% costs for deep retrofit  80% for attic & cavity wall insulation emergency response to energy prices  Access to low cost loans

The National Home Energy Upgrade Scheme is an unprecedented investment to retrofit our homes.  In short, the plan means:  ✔More investment ✔Tackling energy poverty ✔Making it easy ✔Creating jobs ✔Climate action  #TimeToRetrofit

Just launched the biggest home insulation scheme offered by the state.  The National Home Energy Upgrade Scheme will :  👉Cut climate emissions 👉Tackle fuel poverty & price inflation  👉Improve people's health  👉Deliver social justice   Proud day to be @greenparty_ie https://t.co/GCziJ6ElJZ
Flying formations. #hightide #dublinbaybiosphere #strandroad #sandymount #dublincanbeheaven #seabirds #wadingbirds #beach https://t.co/sDZiKi93Vh
Round up of the week in images.  #highlightsoftheweek https://t.co/MhLn6yHrwZ
Overview of some of the work carried out this week.  #highlightsoftheweek https://t.co/W1e6HMuave

Had the opportunity to sit down with @collision & @CiaranCuffe to talk about delivering on carbon neutrality.  Fantastic to hear the actions #stripe has already carried out in the area.  We will contuine to work with businesses to deliver climate action responses. https://t.co/eup5bowNUv

Wonderful to chat with Peter Boyle, taxi driver from Dublin 🚕 who switched to a electric through the electric vehicle taxi scheme.  We re-opened it today with €15 million allocated by the @Dept_Transport in 2022.   🚩https://t.co/d3NJIGMjwN https://t.co/tSR9lo0X08 https://t.co/0gLTC5OlgO

#TownCentresFirst seeks to support ,enable and inspire communities; reinvigorating independent retail & promoting town center living.  Business & residents will be able to access funding & supports through 'one stop shop' in each local authority. #OurRuralFuture https://t.co/PShoEDM4Ea

Pleasure to meet ⁦@LordMayorDublin⁩ today to discuss our common desire to see Dublin thrive. We shared our latest thinking about how tackling vacancy, promoting sustainable mobility and providing district heating solutions can help make that happen. ⁦@DubCityCouncil⁩ https://t.co/enZnrNxW1Q

At the ⁦Gaiety⁩ last night Gabriel Byrne played the ghosts of his past. Auld characters, celeb alcoholics, bad priests. In a powerful moment telling how he gave up the demon drink, a chancer from the audience spoke for all when he shouted out ‘good man Gabriel’. #VeryDublin https://t.co/2Slj05XZZw

Happy St. Bridgid"s Day. When we celebrate the arrival of Spring, Mother Nature, returning light, regrowth and the power of female creation in every blooming thing. #LáFéileBríde #imbolc #Brigit2022 #StBrigidsDay #love #nature #life https://t.co/MI3mb3H8QZ
https://t.co/nkn13MY8MJ

A good day for Dublin--I've been campaigning for years for the Cathal Brugha Barracks in Rathmines to be used for public and affordable housing. A feasibility study will  now take place to bring 1,000 high quality homes to the area. https://t.co/RPAVogB35e
We have to accelerate delivery. With low cost, experimental measures we will see a transformation in how we travel.  https://t.co/xwfs0JacFS https://t.co/sUiYEhb9Jf

Our investment in active travel is starting to bear fruit. Now we must accelerate delivery to give everyone the opportunity to move around their communities with safety and comfort. The shift to remote working is another chance to use road space for quicker, cleaner transport. https://t.co/NBCvepYpLC

📢I'm inviting applications for the role of #CommunicationsAssistant  This is a great opportunity to promote #ClimateAction and sustainable #Transport--working with my ministerial team and colleagues across @Dept_ECC and  @Dept_Transport   Apply now: 🔗https://t.co/HL25bQzxtQ https://t.co/gx99yvT5GY

50 years ago today Ireland signed our accession treaty to join the EU. I’m proud to be at the EU Energy Council today as geopolitics push up gas prices, which threaten fuel poverty for our people. We are agreed the best protection is in our green new deal. #renewables #efficiency https://t.co/fZKZnnc3Ky

We have launched a consultation on a Maritime Area Consent (MAC) regime for the first phase of offshore renewable energy projects. Closing date is 16 February, #HaveYourSay here: https://t.co/xl2QiTFWgg #ClimateActionIRL https://t.co/a6uCnnCsxT

A new public holiday to celebrate St Brigid will reconnect us with our deeper cultural and feminine tradition.  Lá Fhéile Bríde marks the return of light, the return of life.  🔗https://t.co/XLckRGhPgM https://t.co/cSz6GwzwIE

📢I'm inviting applications for the role of #CommunicationsAssistant  This is a great opportunity to promote #ClimateAction and sustainable transport--working with my ministerial team and colleagues across @Dept_ECC and @Dept_Transport   More details⬇️  https://t.co/HL25bQzxtQ

Here are the minutes of the Government meeting 100 years ago. We held a special cabinet meeting today, to mark the occasion and to recommit to serve as best we can, before the democratic will of the people is exercised for a 34th time & the next government keeps up the tradition. https://t.co/qW5Z8SWop2

100 years ago today the Provisional Government took over the running of our country. For all our failings, I think the Republican ethos which inspired our founders & shaped our constitution, has served us well. We will follow in that tradition, as we face the challenges of today. https://t.co/iaEMMufYIJ
Thinking of Ashling Murphy family, friends, colleagues, and the entire community of Tullamore at a tribute for her on Kildare Street.  Ar dheis Dé go raibh a hanam dílis. https://t.co/BuzRn2Om0Q

Congratulations to Aditya Joshi and Aditya Kumar from @SyngeStreetCBS on this fantastic achievement. The judges praised the students' "elegant work and creative ideas". I wish them best of luck representing Ireland at the European Union Contest for Young Scientists in Sept 22. https://t.co/ufbfQQbMlS

He was one of the most inspiring person I have met and played a key role in supporting @ClimateGather, which did great work in thinking about how we inspire people to take climate action. https://t.co/TTirQ9UUlJ

I was delighted to discuss the Climate Challenge with the @RIAIOnline this morning. Architects play a key role in improving the performance of the built environment not only through retrofits but in placemaking, provision for #ActiveTravel, and high quality public realm. https://t.co/4B5ieEc9lX
These increases should help improve the safety of all vulnerable road and footpath users, by creating a more effective deterrent to these specific forms of illegal parking. 📌https://t.co/MGY08FjDdZ

New regulations doubling the fixed charge penalty for motorists caught parking on footpaths, cycle tracks and bus lanes will come into operation on Feb 1, 2022. Illegal parking puts vulnerable road users at risk and undermines State investment in sustainable transport. https://t.co/44QFdIZWYO

The flash flooding yesterday did a lot of damage to roads and bridges  across the South-East and Wexford in particular. We are committed to providing the support needed for local councils to be able to manage and repair the damage done. @Dept_Transport  https://t.co/RtoUU34NMr
NIFTI sets out clear principles for the consideration of future transport investment and is closely aligned with the Climate Action Plan and the National Development Plan. 🔗https://t.co/509gXzVG7M

The National Investment Framework for Transport in Ireland (NIFTI) recognises that transport investment plays a key role in where and how we live and travel. This framework will deliver a cleaner, greener transport system—one that provides accessibility and opportunity for all. https://t.co/tSEKLsUavp

⚡️I'm delighted to announce Government approval for the Micro-generation Support Scheme  Domestic, community, farming and small commercial customers have an important role to play in shaping electricity demand and decarbonising homes and businesses  🔗https://t.co/pdCjWnaHjz https://t.co/THBTP8vpU7

Transport Infrastructure Ireland (TII) has issued the Greenways and national road funding allocations for 2022 totalling €676m 🚲Development of National Cycle Network 📜New Code of Practice 🛣️Roads projects to prioritise safety, connectivity & bypasses 📍https://t.co/tPg6b8hP41 https://t.co/M1UVJ2tytx

Congratulations to ⁦@paulinegalway⁩ who has been elected chair of ⁦@greenparty_ie⁩ . Well done as well ⁦@BlaithinLeitrim⁩ and ⁦@ColetteFinnCork⁩, who made it such an inspiring election campaign, in the best democratic tradition of our party. https://t.co/8mkz9DQXS2

Government is very conscious that international energy prices are having a significant effect on utility bills. We took measures in the Budget to support vulnerable groups; this credit is designed to provide all householders with a contribution to electricity bills in Spring 2022 https://t.co/2tv07V023y

€100 payment to all domestic electricity accounts has been approved by Cabinet today as part of a suite of measures to mitigate the effects of the unprecedented rise in electricity prices... 📌https://t.co/rIh8N6KcGj
Road Safety Strategy 2021-2030 Launch https://t.co/2xptvV9BMR via @YouTube
On @RTENewsAtOne today to promote this transformative programme that will ensure train travel is at the heart of Ireland’s sustainable transport network https://t.co/uJq37uDNYK

⚡️An initial order has been placed for 95 electrically-powered carriages set for delivery mid-2024 and entering service in 2025  DART+ will double the capacity and treble the electrification of the Greater Dublin Area network  📌https://t.co/bQT743NX97 https://t.co/rR4iEUxUCe

📢 Iarnród Éireann has signed the contract for the largest and most sustainable fleet in Irish public transport history: 750 new rail carriages over 10 years  📺 Preview the new look DART+ fleet, with enhanced space for families, wheelchair users, and e-bike charging  @irishrail https://t.co/wDO6SXGWnL

Very glad to get my booster shot in city west this morning. In and out in just half an hour. As usual a fantastic team at the centre, doing lifesaving work for us all. Thank you ⁦@HSELive⁩ #getyourbooster #covid19 https://t.co/YC5Knpfa8F

Successful businesses know that cutting their emissions and waste makes both financial & environmental sense. The #ClimateToolkit will help them take action in a very practical way, and it highlights the support that is available from government agencies to make those changes. https://t.co/jvWUWNBdyO

This is a hugely significant decision which fulfils a key commitment in the Programme for Government. It's a tangible demonstration of progress, which will transform public transport and help us meet our climate goals.   📌https://t.co/9O4vxx37fw

📢Dart+ West has been given government approval to enter the planning system  Government also approved preliminary business case for the wider DART+ Programme:  🚉 double capacity 🛤️ treble network ⚡️ electric rail  A milestone for sustainable transport in the Greater Dublin Area https://t.co/D07GwUBPzg

We take on the Presidency of North Seas Energy Cooperation #NSEC for the next year as nine countries sign a new political declaration to deliver 300GW of offshore wind. We can protect ourselves from high prices and insecurity from imported fossil fuels. https://t.co/GZIHEAKU24 https://t.co/I0mO7jIFiP

Leo Monaghan, a taxi driver living in Headford, Co Galway, has made the switch to an electric vehicle, reducing his fuel costs by almost 80%.  For Leo, "it makes sense to go electric" #ClimateActionIRL  📌https://t.co/bFc1ZLGSLn  https://t.co/a6SBrSAUX1

Best of luck to the 50 cycling advocates beginning training today. These young women will blaze a trail in their communities and we'll support you with continued investment in the infrastructure you need. #AndSheCycles #GreenSchools https://t.co/qwu0OMftVm
